channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2017: Rory Best to captain Lions against Hurricanes
item.description: Rory Best will captain the British and Irish Lions for the team's next game against the Hurricanes on Tuesday.

item.title: Pressure led to 'beautiful' qualifying lap - Hamilton
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says he thrives under "pressure" after salvaging a pole position in Azerbaijan with a "beautiful lap".

item.title: India shock England in Women's World Cup opener - report & highlights
item.description: Hosts England have four players run out as they suffer a 35-run defeat by India in their opening Women's World Cup match at Derby.

item.title: Cilic to meet Lopez in Queen's final - report & highlights
item.description: Spain's Feliciano Lopez sees off former champion Grigor Dimitrov to set up an Aegon Championships final against Croatian fourth seed Marin Cilic.

item.title: Jeremy Guscott column: The Lions had the chances, the All Blacks had the class
item.description: The British and Irish Lions could have won, but All Blacks skill ensures no 'what-could-have-beens', says Lions great Jeremy Guscott.

item.title: Aikines-Aryeetey wins twice as GB sit third
item.description: Great Britain sit third after day two at the European Team Championships with Harry Aikines-Aryeetey winning in the 100m and 4x100m relay.

item.title: Highlights: England women fall short in valiant run chase
item.description: Watch highlights as England fall short of their highest ODI chase, losing by 35 runs to India in their opening Women's World Cup match in Derby.

item.title: Kvitova reaches first final since stabbing
item.description: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova reaches her first final since returning from a career-threatening hand injury.

item.title: Watford sign Derby midfielder Hughes for £8m
item.description: Watford complete the signing of midfielder Will Hughes from Derby County for £8m on a five-year deal.

item.title: Ronaldo helps Portugal into Confederations Cup semis
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a penalty as Portugal beat New Zealand 4-0 to seal their semi-final place at the Confederations Cup.

item.title: Five best shots as Lopez beats Dimitrov to reach Queen's final
item.description: Watch five of the best shots as Feliciano Lopez beats Grigor Dimitrov 7-5 3-6 6-2 to set up a Queen's final against Marin Cilic.

item.title: England U21s face Germany in Euro 2017 semis
item.description: England Under-21s will face Germany in Tuesday's European Championship semi-final in Poland.

item.title: NW Arkansas Championship: Ryu So-yeon takes lead with record score
item.description: Ryu So-yeon cards a tournament-record 10-under-par 61 to take a five-stroke lead heading into the final round of the NW Arkansas Championship.

item.title: I'm going after 110m world record - McLeod
item.description: Olympic gold medallist Omar McLeod is focusing on the 110m hurdles world record after setting a Jamaican national record with a time of 12.90 seconds.

item.title: England lose to Netherlands in semi-finals - report & highlights
item.description: England are knocked out of the World League Semi-Final after a 2-0 last-four defeat by the Netherlands.

item.title: One gold among eight England medals - report & highlights
item.description: England win one gold and six silver medals on the final day of competition at the European Boxing Championships.

item.title: Spieth leads by one at Travelers Championship
item.description: American Jordan Spieth will take a one-shot lead into the final round of the Travelers Championship.

item.title: Personalise your BBC Sport app and sign up for notifications
item.description: With latest scores and headlines sent straight to your device, personalisation and much more, ensure you have a great sporting life with BBC Sport.

item.title: European Boxing Championships 2017: England's Peter McGrail wins gold
item.description: England's Peter McGrail takes gold in the 56kg final beating Ukraine's Mykola Butsenko at the European Boxing Championships.

item.title: Queen's 2017: Five best shots as Marin Cilic beats Gilles Muller
item.description: Watch five of the best shots as Marin Cilic wins his semi-final against Gilles Muller at Queen's 6-3 5-7 6-4.

item.title: Women's World Cup: Three dropped catches but England finally catch Punam Raut
item.description: England's fielders drop India's Punam Raut three times before she is finally caught by Danni Wyatt for 86 during the opening match of the 2017 Women's World Cup.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Warren Gatland rues errors in loss to New Zealand
item.description: British and Irish Lions head coach Warren Gatland says his side will try and cut out the errors that cost them a win against New Zealand in the first Test of the series.

item.title: Hockey World League 2017: Netherlands beat England 2-0 in semi-final
item.description: England are knocked out of the World League Semi-Final after a 2-0 last-four defeat by the Netherlands.

item.title: England v South Africa: Hosts collapse from 125-1 to 171-6
item.description: Watch England's batting collapse against South Africa as they go from 125-1 to 171-6 and lose by three runs in the second Twenty20 at Taunton.

item.title: Dan Evans: Pundits on British number three's failed drugs test
item.description: BBC's tennis team of Sue Barker, Peter Fleming and John Lloyd discuss British number three Dan Evans' failed drugs test.

item.title: England v South Africa: Jason Roy given out obstructing the field
item.description: England batsman Jason Roy is controversially given out for obstructing the field against South Africa during the second Twenty20 at Taunton.

item.title: Henry Blofeld: Seagulls, trousers & porpoises - Blofeld's best pint-sized moments
item.description: Henry Blofeld retires from BBC Radio's Test Match Special in September, so BBC Sport have collected together some of his best pint-sized moments.

item.title: Predict who will win Azerbaijan GP
item.description: Can the fastest street circuit in Formula 1 produce a thrilling contest? Predict who you think will win in Baku.

item.title: 'To lead England out in the World Cup will be special'
item.description: Women's Sport Week continues as Heather Knight puts away her crutches in time to lead England into the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Ready for another round of 200mph chess? Azerbaijan GP preview
item.description: The Baku City Circuit needs to deliver a memorable race after a uninspired debut, while Lewis Hamilton could bump into an old flame.

item.title: Wimbledon: Pick your greatest moments from Arthur Ashe to Andy Murray
item.description: The BBC is celebrating 90 years at Wimbledon by giving you the chance to pick your top three moments from the All England Club.

item.title: Sport on the BBC: Best of this week's TV & radio coverage
item.description: This week's sport on the BBC includes tennis from Queen's Club, horse racing at Royal Ascot and the Azerbaijan Grand Prix.

item.title: The favourites, the players, the records - your Women's World Cup guide
item.description: Who are definitely going to cause an upset? Which England player is "fired up"? BBC Sport previews the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Would 60-minute games work? Banning penalty rebounds? BBC pundit has his say
item.description: BBC football analyst Pat Nevin looks at the proposals to change the laws of the game and gives his verdict on the more radical ideas.

item.title: 10 sports stars who became actors
item.description: Eric Cantona, Lewis Hamilton and eight more sports figures who have tried their hand at film roles.
